conbody.note: Dialog Nibelung will automatically find an audio hub connected to the classroom LAN and will reconfigure itself to take advantage of the available hardware. Otherwise, it will operate in regular mode as described in section .
The audio hub allows connections to a maximum of 30 student workstations. Student workstations with IDs above 30 will still be able to communicate via the classroom LAN.
conbody.p: There is an icon indicating presence of the audio hub in Dialog Nibelung teacher module status bar (#1 in ). This icon becomes colored whenever Dialog Nibelung has established communications with the audio hub.

fig.title: Audio hub status icon in the teacher module

image.alt: Audio hub status icon in the teacher module

conbody.p: Likewise, student modules connected to the audio hub will display the same icon in place of the online/offline status icon in the status bar (#4 in ).

fig.title: Audio hub status icon in the student module

image.alt: Audio hub status icon in the student module

conbody.p: A new Audio hub item will appear in the Media sources menu (section ) whenever Dialog Nibelung recognizes an audio hub.
If an external source is selected, you can also choose between several external sources connected to the audio hub, and adjust their volume.
conbody.note: If Student is selected as the audio hub source, any student chosen by the teacher (see ) and connected to the audio hub can be a media source for the selected group. All students in the group must also be served by the audio hub.
conbody.p: The rest of the audio hub controls in this tab work as described in section .
